OCD.name: EncryptedQuery Standalone Runner
OCD.description: Allows for the instantiation of Standalone Runners through OSGi configuration.

AD.name: Name
AD.description: Short name of this query runner. This name is used to identify the DataSource to the Querier componentso queries can be submitted using this name for execution.

AD.name: Description
AD.description: Description of this query runner for display to the end user.

AD.name: data.schema.name
AD.description: Name of the DataSchema describing the fields and partitioners.

AD.name: data.source.file
AD.description: Absolute File name for the source data to be queried against.

AD.name: data.source.record.type
AD.description: Record type (i.e. json, csv, etc). Only JSON is supported at the moment.

AD.name: .column.encryption.class.name
AD.description: Class name of the encryption method to be used.

AD.name: .mod.pow.class.name
AD.description: Class name of the Modulus Power method to be used.

AD.name: Run Directory
AD.description: Path to a directory to use as the parent directory to store temporary files during the execution of the query.Every execution will create temporary directories under this one.

AD.name: Java executable path
AD.description: Path to the java executable program.

AD.name: Java runtime options.
AD.description: Options to Java runtime, such as Heap size, etc.

AD.name: Standalone application jar path
AD.description: Path to the standalone application jar.

AD.name: Number of thread to use.
AD.description: Number of threads to use for processing of the Query.

AD.name: .jni.library.path
AD.description: Comma separated list of native libraries to load. Optional.
